text: The Battle of Rorke's Drift was a battle in the Anglo-Zulu war. The battle happened after the Battle of Isandlwana. A group of Zulus went to attack Rorke's Drift (a British mission station) after they won the battle. 150 British and colonial soldiers fought 3,000 to 4,000 Zulus. The British were able to defend the mission station. Category:1879 in Africa Category:History of South Africa Category:Battles involving the United Kingdom
title: Battle of Rorke's Drift
